root.name: set()
root.description: Sets the uniform variables inside the shader to modify the effect while the program is running.
root.syntax: .set(name, x) .set(name, x, y) .set(name, x, y, z) .set(name, x, y, z, w) .set(name, vec) .set(name, vec, ncoords) .set(name, boolvec, ncoords) .set(name, mat) .set(name, mat, use3x3) .set(name, tex)

parameter.label: name
parameter.description: String: the name of the uniform variable to modify

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: boolean, float, or int: first component of the variable to modify

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: boolean, float, or int: second component of the variable to modify. The variable has to be declared with an array/vector type in the shader (i.e.: int[2], vec2)

parameter.label: z
parameter.description: boolean, float, or int: third component of the variable to modify. The variable has to be declared with an array/vector type in the shader (i.e.: int[3], vec3)

parameter.label: w
parameter.description: boolean, float, or int: fourth component of the variable to modify. The variable has to be declared with an array/vector type in the shader (i.e.: int[4], vec4)

parameter.label: vec
parameter.description: boolean, float, int, or PVector: modifies all the components of an array/vector uniform variable. PVector can only be used if the type of the variable is vec3.

parameter.label: ncoords
parameter.description: int: number of coordinates per element, max 4

parameter.label: mat
parameter.description: PMatrix3D, or PMatrix2D: matrix of values

parameter.label: use3x3
parameter.description: boolean: enforces the matrix is 3 x 3

parameter.label: tex
parameter.description: PImage: sets the sampler uniform variable to read from this image texture
